text: A 5.9 magnitude earthquake has leveled seven villages in Iran's southern area, killing 10 persons and wounding other 70, Iranian officials were quoted by AP as saying. According to Iran's seismologic center, the epicenter of the earthquake was in the waters of the Persian Gulf, between the port city of Bandar Abbas and Qeshm Island. Qeshm's governor, Heidar Alishvandi, told the state television that rescue teams have been deployed to the affected areas and that the population from the villages is now safe. A reporter of the Iranian news agency, IRNA, said that the only hospital in Qeshm was full of people and that there was a shortage of medical facilities. According to the same agency, the Deyrestan village saw serious destruction, while Tonban and Goursin were all but destroyed. The main temblor was followed by at least four major aftershocks, with magnitudes ranging from 3.6 to 4.3, which increased the panic among villagers. Qeshm, a 1, 500 - square - kilometer island off the coast southwest of Bandar Abbas and 1, 500 kilometers south of Tehran, has a population of more than 100, 000.
title: 5.9 Earthquake Jolts Iran.
